item.title: Were Duterte’s Speeches Orders to Kill or Hyperbole?
item.description: Judges at the International Criminal Court have heard starkly different interpretations this week of the words of former President Rodrigo Duterte of the Philippines.

item.title: BA owner’s profits rise by 20% despite drop in passenger numbers last year
item.description: IAG reports record operating profits on margins of more than 15% at British Airways and sister airline Iberia British Airways’ owner, International Airlines Group, has announced a sharp rise in annual profits to almost £4bn despite a slight fall in passenger numbers in 2025. Pre-tax profits across IAG increased by 20% to €4.5bn (£3.9bn), with record operating profits on margins of more than 15% at BA and its sister airline Iberia. Continue reading...

item.title: Watch: BBC on streets of Mexican city gripped by deadly cartel violence
item.description: BBC international correspondent Quentin Sommerville travelled to Culiacán in northern Sinaloa state following an explosion in violence.
